comment._content: George Alfred Carlson (October 23, 1876, Alta, Iowa – December 6, 1926, Denver, Colorado) was the 20th Governor of Colorado from 1915-17.

comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: The Wikipedia article could use the picture. It seems to have only a painting so far (and not much information)... en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Alfred_Carlson Carlson's administration was noted for labor reforms, including the passage of a workers' compensation law and the establishment of the Industrial Commission of Colorado. He also supported and signed into law a prohibition bill making Colorado a "dry state."

comment.author: 62539202@N05
comment._content: Do you have any photos of 1905, In Cádiz, Spain?

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: Thanks for the biographical information about Carlson! Jasamaphoto: A good place to start to see what photos we have in the Library of Congress collections is in the Prints & Photographs Online Catalog ( www.loc.gov/pictures). I don't spot any images of Cadiz specifically from 1905 in the catalog--here's a search that retrieves images with "Cadiz" and "Spain" in the description: www.loc.gov/pictures/search/?q=cadiz%20spain . We can do some further searching in the collections that are not individually described online if you want to contact us through our "Ask a Librarian" service: www.loc.gov/rr/askalib/ask-print.html
